channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: In Kerrville, community rushes in to help after flooding
item.description: In Kerr County, Texas, people say they're eager to help their neighbors who have lost everything due to flooding. The community has found a gathering place in a local church.

item.title: United Cajun Navy helps Texans deal with flood aftermath
item.description: The search for missing people in central Texas continues. Volunteers from the United Cajun Navy have traveled from the state of Louisiana to help.

item.title: What is known about a Russian minister's death hours after being fired by Putin
item.description: A Russian official named Roman Starovoit acted as the Kremlin's Transportation Minister was reported dead hours after Putin fired him. Officials say he died by suicide.

item.title: Local officials are reluctant to discuss accountability in the Texas flooding
item.description: The flash flooding in Texas hit Kerr County the hardest. More than 80 people died and the number is feared to increase as crews reach decimated areas of the Guadalupe River.

item.title: A preview of the controversial new building at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art
item.description: Previews of a new building at the LA County Museum of Art began last week. Some have bemoaned the cost and design, but many in attendance had nice things to say about the striking new galleries.

item.title: Houthi rebels resume attacks on shipping vessels
item.description: The Houthi rebel group in Yemen have resumed attacking shipping vessels in the Red Sea.

item.title: Why writer Jenny Han understands embarrassment so well
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Writer Jenny Han talks about why she understands embarrassment so well.

item.title: DOJ memo says no evidence of Jeffrey Epstein 'client list' or blackmail
item.description: Conspiracy theories have swirled around disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein since his death in a federal lockup in 2019. On Monday, a department released a memo that reaffirmed previous conclusions.

item.title: An AI imposter is pretending to be Marco Rubio
item.description: An AI imposter is making calls to officials. Who is the AI imposter impersonating? United States Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

item.title: The new Trump Accounts give kids $1,000. What should parents do?
item.description: Parents can contribute a total of up to $5,000 to a Trump Account annually, until the year their child turns 18. But should they do that? And where does it stand compared to other savings options?
